title: Coal - global proved reserves by type 2010 to 2018
summary: Overall Anthracite and bituminous is gradually increasing, Sub-bituminous and lignite is gradually decreasing,  throughout the Year
The order of lines according to average values of Reserves in million metric tons, in descending order is: 1. Anthracite and bituminous, and lastly, 2. Sub-bituminous and lignite.
Sub-bituminous and lignite reported the lowest Reserves in million metric tons about 323117.0 in Year 2016
The difference of Reserves in million metric tons between Anthracite and bituminous and Sub-bituminous and lignite is greater at Year 2016 compared to the Year 2012.
min_summary: Overall Anthracite and bituminous is gradually increasing, Sub-bituminous and lignite is gradually decreasing,  throughout the Year
mid_summary: Overall Anthracite and bituminous is gradually increasing, Sub-bituminous and lignite is gradually decreasing,  throughout the Year
max_summary: Overall Anthracite and bituminous is gradually increasing, Sub-bituminous and lignite is gradually decreasing,  throughout the Year
Sub-bituminous and lignite reported the lowest Reserves in million metric tons about 323117.0 in Year 2016
The greatest difference of Reserves in million metric tons between Anthracite and bituminous and Sub-bituminous and lignite occurs at Year 2016 and the smallest difference occurs at 2012.
